meanings.definition: To make a hissing or sputtering sound.
meanings.sent1: The firework started to fizzle in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The candle began to fizzle out as the wax melted away.
meanings.sent3: The soda can fizzle when you open it too quickly.
meanings.sent4: The damp wood made the fire fizzle and pop.
meanings.sent5: The frying pan made the oil fizzle loudly.

meanings.sent1: His plan to surprise her with flowers began to fizzle when she saw him coming.
meanings.sent2: The excitement of the party started to fizzle as people began to leave.
meanings.sent3: The balloon's attempt to fly away started to fizzle comically.
meanings.sent4: The team's chances of winning began to fizzle as the game progressed.
meanings.sent5: Her enthusiasm for the project started to fizzle after facing many obstacles.

meanings.sent1: The fizzle of the soda was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The fizzle of the sparklers added to the festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected fizzle of the firecracker made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The fizzle of the fireworks echoed through the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The sudden fizzle of the balloon popping startled the children.
